t: Proverbs 5
My*p son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
That*p thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
For*p the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
But*p her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.
Her*p feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
Lest*p thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
Hear*p me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
Remove*p thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
Lest*p thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
Lest*p strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
And*p thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
And*p say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
And*p have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
I*p was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
Drink*p waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
Let*p thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
Let*p them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.
Let*p thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
Let*p her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
And*p why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
For*p the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord,*s and he pondereth all his goings.
His*p own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
He*p shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
